description:
This course is a comprehensive guide to mastering the remarkable fields of decision-making, behavioural economics, and cognitive bias. Have you ever wondered how you could learn to frame decisions to get better results, or how you could avoid the status quo bias? How about learning to process and manage complex risks? And what is the role of intuition in any decision? Behavioural economics is the field of research into how human beings think, decide, and act. This course translates the key findings of the past five decades of research into tools and principles for you to use in life, business, and leadership.

By the end of this course you'll understand the many pitfalls we are prone to make in decision-making (cognitive biases), how to avoid them, and how to help guide others into better, more empowered, more rational decision making.

Ready to become a veritable Jedi at decisions? Let's get started!

You will receive a certificate upon completion of this course.
title: Cognitive biases: learn to master decision-making
